headlineText: S&P 500 e-minis logged their biggest losing streak in seven years on Friday, dropping about 0.6 percent on growing worries of slowing global growth and the threat of a U.S. government shutdown.
headlineTitle: Futures extend slide on growth fears, government shutdown threat

headlineText: Taiwan's Foxconn , Apple Inc's iPhone assembler, is in the final stages of talks with the local government of the Chinese city of Zhuhai to build a chip plant there with a total investment of about $9 billion, the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.
headlineTitle: Foxconn to build $9 billion chip plant in China with local govt: Nikkei

headlineText: The German food retailer Kaufland on Friday said that it was dropping Unilever products from its shelves to protest against price increases.
headlineTitle: German retailer Kaufland drops Unilever products over price rises

headlineText: As Venezuela collapses, one little-known U.S. investment fund is poised to win big from litigation against its socialist government: Tenor Capital Management.
headlineTitle: Want to sue Venezuela for millions? These firms can help, for a price

headlineText: Japanese prosecutors arrested Nissan Motor Co Ltd's ousted chairman Carlos Ghosn again on Friday on new allegations of making Nissan shoulder $16.6 million in personal investment losses, dashing chances he would be released on bail before Christmas.
headlineTitle: Ghosn re-arrested on fresh allegations, likely to spend Christmas in detention

headlineText: The possible withdrawal of Japanese conglomerates from nuclear export projects in Britain and Turkey would leave the nuclear newbuild industry open to Russian and Chinese state-owned companies as Western private firms struggle to compete.
headlineTitle: Japan Inc exit from nuclear exports would leave field to Russia, China

headlineText: SoftBank Group Corp is nearing a deal to invest $1.5 billion in Grab, three times a previously expected $500 million, as Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing firm looks to expand, a person with knowledge of the matter said.
headlineTitle: SoftBank's Vision Fund nearing $1.5 billion investment in SE Asia's Grab: source

headlineText: Japanese prosecutors arrested Nissan's ousted chairman Carlos Ghosn for a third time on Friday, accusing him of aggravated breach of trust in transferring personal investment losses to the automaker.
headlineTitle: Explainer: Arrested again: What are the new allegations against Nissan's Ghosn?

headlineText: What's does a company do when it doesn't have enough workers and unemployment rates are at record lows? In eastern Europe answers includes workplace massages, free carp for Christmas and guaranteed jobs for spouses.
headlineTitle: Massages and free fish help east Europe tackle labor shortages

headlineText: Toshiba Corp has no immediate plans to sell its 40.2 percent stake in Toshiba Memory Corp, its chief executive told Reuters, as the world's No. 2 producer of NAND flash memory chips prepares to go public within the next three years.
headlineTitle: Toshiba has no immediate plans to sell memory chip stake: CEO

headlineText: China, the world's top oil importer, is set to start 2019 buying little or no crude from the United States despite a three-month truce in a trade scrap between the two nations, with relatively high freight costs and political uncertainty choking demand.
headlineTitle: Crude refusal: China shuns U.S. oil despite trade war truce

headlineText: China plans to make a third round of U.S. soybean purchases within days, two sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday, after a trade war truce between Washington and Beijing this month triggered two waves of buying.
headlineTitle: China poised to buy more U.S. soybeans: sources

headlineText: Bangladesh will collect and test samples of Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder for asbestos in a couple of days, its main testing authority said on Friday, after a Reuters report last Friday that the firm knew for decades that cancer-causing asbestos could be found in the product.
headlineTitle: Exclusive: Bangladesh says to collect, test samples of Johnson & Johnson Baby Powder

headlineText: The growing acceptance of man-made diamonds by millennials has spurred De Beers to reverse its policy of shunning the sector for jewelry and to launch its own laboratory-grown diamonds through its Lightbox jewelry brand.
headlineTitle: Factbox: How man-made diamonds have grown to threaten natural gems

headlineText: Faced with a chronic shortage of truck drivers, logistics firm Deutsche Post DHL Group is trialing a new scheme to get more people behind the wheel so it can keep goods flowing across Europe, especially at peak times like Christmas.
headlineTitle: Keeping on truckin': DHL seeks to counter driver shortages

headlineText: India's drugs regulator has ordered Johnson & Johnson to stop manufacturing its Baby Powder using raw materials in two of its Indian factories until test results prove they are free of asbestos, a senior official said on Thursday.
headlineTitle: Indian regulator orders J&J to stop using raw material to make Baby Powder in India

headlineText: Dealmakers celebrating their third-strongest year on record are fretting 2019 will herald a steep drop in mergers and acquisitions worldwide, as market jitters and economic uncertainty take their toll.
headlineTitle: Dealmakers brace for slowdown after third-strongest M&A year

headlineText: A trade secrets lawsuit brought by Canada's Bombardier Inc against the aircraft unit of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd should be dismissed because the allegations are baseless and designed to "disrupt development" of a rival jet, a spokesman for the Japanese company said on Thursday.
headlineTitle: Mitsubishi seeks dismissal of Bombardier trade secrets case

headlineText: Vanguard Group, the world's largest mutual fund manager, said on Thursday Chief Executive Bill McNabb will step down at year end and be replaced by Chief Investment Officer Tim Buckley, betting on the internal successor to oversee rapid growth.
headlineTitle: Vanguard CIO Buckley to take over as CEO from McNabb on Jan. 1

headlineText: Wall Street posted slight gains on Thursday and the Dow hit another record high close, with financials rising ahead of profit reports due Friday from several big U.S. banks.
headlineTitle: Wall Street rises as financials lead before earnings

headlineText: The CEO of Retrophin Inc, the drug company that Martin Shkreli founded and is now accused of conspiring to defraud, compared Shkreli to the Pied Piper on Thursday as he tried to explain to jurors why he stuck with the company in its early days despite misgivings.
headlineTitle: CEO of Martin Shkreli's old company likens him to 'Pied Piper'

headlineText: SoundCloud, the world's biggest music-streaming service, is still struggling to find a business model - it now has enough cash to last until fourth quarter, after laying off 40 percent of its staff, a representative said on Thursday.
headlineTitle: Music streamer SoundCloud has cash until fourth quarter after layoffs

headlineText: U.S. Energy Secretary Rick Perry promised on Thursday to promote cross-border electricity trade and investment with Mexico and said he expected talks aimed at updating the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) to proceed quickly.
headlineTitle: U.S. energy secretary in Mexico eyes cooperation

headlineText: Daily fantasy sports companies FanDuel and DraftKings scrapped a plan to merge on Thursday following a legal challenge by U.S. antitrust enforcers.
headlineTitle: FanDuel, DraftKings scrap troubled merger

headlineText: Upbeat data helped send world shares to a fourth all-time high in less than a month on Thursday as Wall Street edged higher in anticipation of solid earnings, while crude oil gained on evidence of stronger demand in China.
headlineTitle: World shares rise to fresh peak; oil gains

headlineText: Delta Air Lines Inc on Thursday reported a 21 percent drop in second-quarter profit because of sharply higher labor and fuel costs, despite higher passenger unit revenue, sending its shares down 2 percent.
headlineTitle: Delta's profit tumbles on higher costs; passenger unit revenue rises

headlineText: Delta Air Lines will not delay its 2018 deliveries of CSeries planes from Canada's Bombardier Inc , the carrier's chief executive said on Thursday, following an anti-dumping complaint by Boeing Co against the jets.
headlineTitle: Boeing trade complaint won't slow CSeries deliveries: Delta CEO

headlineText: Trump International Hotels Management LLC said late on Tuesday a data breach at a service provider compromised card payment details at 14 of its properties.
headlineTitle: Trump Hotels discloses data breach at 14 properties

headlineText: Walt Disney Co accepted a demand by Brazil's antitrust regulator CADE that it sell local rights for the Fox Sports channel to win approval of its takeover of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc, the regulator said on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: Disney agrees to sell Fox Sports in Brazil to win antitrust nod

headlineText: Wells Fargo & Co said on Wednesday that it entered preliminary settlement discussions with the U.S. Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission over previously disclosed probes into its sales practices.
headlineTitle: Wells Fargo starts settlement talks with Justice Dept, SEC

headlineText: Southwest Airlines Co said on Wednesday it won approval from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration to begin flying to Hawaii from California, clearing the way for the low-cost carrier to move forward with a key part of its 2019 growth plan.
headlineTitle: Southwest Airlines wins U.S. approval for Hawaii service

headlineText: The S&P 500 closed down slightly on Wednesday but well above its session low after testimonies to U.S. Congress from trade and central bank officials as well as President Donald Trump's former lawyer brought few major surprises.
headlineTitle: Wall Street steadies after Lighthizer, Powell, Cohen testimonies

headlineText: Walt Disney Co is actively pursuing the purchase of WarnerMedia's nearly 10 percent stake in Hulu, entertainment business news portal Variety reported on Wednesday, citing sources.
headlineTitle: Disney in talks with AT&T to buy WarnerMedia's Hulu stake: Variety

headlineText: Global stock indexes ended with mostly slight losses on Wednesday after U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said it was too early to predict an outcome in U.S.-China trade talks, although a jump in oil prices lifted shares of energy companies.
headlineTitle: Global stocks slip after U.S. trade official's comments but energy up

headlineText: (This Feb 26 story corrects data in paragraph 11 that was provided by Kent International comparing wages in China to the United States. Fixes typos in Kent chief executive's name in paragraph 24.)
headlineTitle: How U.S. bike companies are steering around Trump's China tariffs

headlineText: German drugs and lab supplies maker Merck KGaA offered $5.9 billion, including debt, for Versum Materials, in a cash deal that tops an offer from U.S. rival Entegris, as both seek to boost their electrochemicals operations.
headlineTitle: Germany's Merck makes $5.9 billion counterbid for Versum

headlineText: FedEx Corp this summer plans to begin testing a robot to handle home deliveries for partners ranging from Walmart Inc to Pizza Hut.
headlineTitle: FedEx partners with Walmart, Pizza Hut to test last-mile delivery robot

headlineText: The United States wants meetings as regularly as once a month to ensure enforcement of any potential trade pact with China, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: U.S. wants regular meetings to ensure trade deal enforcement: Lighthizer

headlineText: Boeing hopes Britain will decide this year on plans to buy E-7 Wedgetail early warning jets, an executive said, after talks last year sparked a row over competition in arms procurement.
headlineTitle: Boeing seeks UK decision on Wedgetail jet buy this year: executive

headlineText: JPMorgan Chase & Co on Wednesday named half a dozen people to a commercial banking team in Europe and new international and Asia-Pacific regional leaders, as the U.S. bank closes in on business clients it hopes to poach from rivals abroad.
headlineTitle: JPMorgan hires commercial bankers, leaders across Europe, Asia

headlineText: Oil futures gained about 2 percent on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories unexpectedly plummeted and as Saudi Arabia brushed aside comments from U.S. President Donald Trump seeking to keep oil prices from climbing.
headlineTitle: Oil rises 2 percent as U.S. crude stocks plunge, OPEC brushes off Trump

headlineText: WeWork is expanding an effort to retain mid-sized businesses which had been leaving the shared office space manager after they grew past the small-company phase, and to catch up with rivals already catering to these clients.
headlineTitle: WeWork aims for the middle with expanded 'HQ' service

headlineText: Amazon.com Inc, Comcast Corp and Electronic Arts Inc submitted initial bids for the holding firm of South Korea's biggest gaming firm Nexon, Maeil Business Newspaper said on Wednesday, citing investment banking sources.
headlineTitle: Amazon, Comcast, Electronic Arts submit bids for Nexon holding firm-Maeil report

headlineText: Exxon Mobil Corp has hired veteran crude traders Mitch Rubinstein and Michael Paradise in Houston, to further boost its trading capabilities, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: Exclusive: Exxon adds veteran traders to bulk up oil trading - sources

headlineText: Shares in Air France-KLM fell sharply as the Dutch government amassed a 14 percent stake in the airline to counter French influence, in a surprise move highlighting tensions over the company's strategic direction.
headlineTitle: Air France-KLM shares slump on surprise Dutch stake buy

headlineText: The Dutch government in recent days has stealthily built up a 14 percent stake in Air France KLM, which it said was needed to protect Dutch interests from growing French dominance in the airline group.
headlineTitle: Factbox: Dutch state builds 14 percent stake in Air France KLM

headlineText: When Air France's new Canadian chief executive met Dutch politicians in The Hague on Feb. 15, he unknowingly set in motion a new chapter in European aviation nationalism.
headlineTitle: Dutch state's Air France-KLM raid shows interventionist mood

headlineText: Airbus has decided to redesign the C295 military transport aircraft it builds in Spain to remove German components following Germany's freeze on arms exports to Saudi Arabia, company sources told Reuters.
headlineTitle: Airbus eyes warplane with no German parts after Saudi arms ban: sources

headlineText: J.C. Penney Co Inc on Friday will end a clothing subscription service venture, the retailer said this week, a move toward sharpening its focus on more-profitable apparel sales and exiting lines like major appliances.
headlineTitle: J.C. Penney pulls plug on clothing subscription service

headlineText: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened sharply in December as slowing global demand and a strong dollar weighed on exports, another sign that economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter.
headlineTitle: U.S. goods trade deficit deteriorates; factory orders edge up

headlineText: The U.S. Commerce Department's Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) will publish the fourth-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) report on Thursday at 08:30 a.m (1330 GMT) after it was delayed by a 35-day partial shutdown of the government that ended on Jan. 25.
headlineTitle: Factbox: U.S. Commerce Department to publish fourth-quarter GDP report Thursday

headlineText: Best Buy Co Inc shares surged 16 percent on Wednesday after it gave an upbeat profit forecast for the year and reported better-than-expected holiday-quarter sales.
headlineTitle: Best Buy shares surge 16 percent on upbeat profit view, robust holiday quarter

headlineText: Qatari, Chinese and Japanese investors all sought "extras" from Barclays as the British bank raised billions of pounds at the height of the credit crisis in 2008, a landmark London criminal trial heard on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: Qatar, China, Japan sought 'extras' after Barclays 2008 fundraising: court

headlineText: Qatar Airways said on Wednesday that it had decided not to go ahead with routes to some planned destinations following a Gulf boycott, particularly in West and Central Africa, the company said in a Twitter post.
headlineTitle: Qatar Airways suspended some destinations planned for Africa after Gulf boycott

headlineText: The United States is seeking to prevent China from competitively devaluing its currency as part of ongoing trade talks between the countries, following past manipulations of the yuan, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: U.S. aims to combat Chinese currency manipulation in trade deal: Lighthizer

headlineText: U.S. home improvement chain Lowe's beat Wall Street earnings forecasts on Wednesday, and predicted that more Americans would renovate their houses this year rather than buy a home in a market where prices are rising.
headlineTitle: Lowe's predicts more home renovations this year after strong profit

headlineText: Air France KLM's board will try and ensure that the stake in the airline taken by the Dutch government will not have a negative impact on the company, the airline said.
headlineTitle: Air France KLM: will look to ensure new Dutch stake does not impact company

headlineText: The Dutch government's decision to increase its stake in Air France KLM was both "incomprehensible" and unexpected, said French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: French Finance Minister: Dutch move on Air France KLM was 'incomprehensible'

headlineText: Campbell Soup Co on Wednesday reported better-than-expected adjusted earnings, helped by its acquisitions of Snyder's-Lance and Pacific Foods.
headlineTitle: Campbell Soup beats earnings estimates, shares rise

headlineText: Mylan NV shares slid 10 percent on Wednesday after the generic drug maker predicted poor 2019 earnings that led some Wall Street analysts to wonder if its finances would worsen further.
headlineTitle: Mylan shares sink as bleak profit outlook sparks growth concerns

headlineText: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened sharply in December as slowing global demand and a strong dollar weighed on exports, another sign that economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter.
headlineTitle: U.S. goods trade deficit widens sharply in December

headlineText: (This Feb. 26 story corrects the name of Equifax in paragraph 2)
headlineTitle: Credit reporting agencies face pressure from skeptical U.S. Congress

headlineText: Ford Motor Co's joint venture with China Changan Automobile Group has decided not to renew its contract with some agencies supplying it with workers, as carmakers struggle to cope with slumping sales in China.
headlineTitle: Ford's China JV ends some contracts with job agencies as sales fall

headlineText: Volkswagen on Wednesday praised its cooperation with Ford and took pains to highlight its rival's autonomous vehicles technology, as both carmakers explore deepening their partnership to include self-driving cars.
headlineTitle: VW praises Ford's autonomous tech as partnership talks continue

headlineText: The European Union should set up a police force to investigate tax evasion and financial crime and create a watchdog to counter money-laundering, EU lawmakers said in a report on Wednesday, which accuses seven member states of acting as tax havens.
headlineTitle: EU needs financial police, money-laundering watchdog: lawmakers

headlineText: Off-price apparel retailer TJX Cos Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly same-store sales on Wednesday, as steep discounts drove more shoppers to its T.J. Maxx and Marshalls stores during the holiday season.
headlineTitle: TJX holiday quarter same-stores sales beat estimates

headlineText: Volkswagen said on Wednesday it had struck a deal with Microsoft to cooperate on cloud computing in China and the United States, as part of its drive to offer connected vehicle services across the globe.
headlineTitle: Volkswagen deepens cloud computing partnership with Microsoft

headlineText: The Fed's policy statements grew so complicated after the recession that standard gauges of readability suggested people needed four years of university or more to understand them.
headlineTitle: You don't need a PhD anymore to read Fed's statements

headlineText: Volvo Cars' luxury performance brand Polestar unveiled its first fully electric sedan on Wednesday, opening up online pre-orders for the five-seater fastback at a price and with a driving range to rival Tesla's mass market Model 3.
headlineTitle: Volvo's Polestar joins electric car race with rival to Tesla 3

headlineText: Saudi Aramco has added Goldman Sachs as a bookrunner for a planned bond which will help finance its purchase of a stake in Saudi Arabian Basic Industries Corp (SABIC), two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.
headlineTitle: Saudi Aramco adds Goldman Sachs as bookrunner for planned bond: sources

headlineText: China's Huawei Technologies and South Korea's Samsung Electronics have agreed to settle a two-year old patent dispute in the United States, court documents show.
headlineTitle: Huawei, Samsung agree to settle patent dispute in U.S. court

headlineText: U.S. investor Cerberus, a major shareholder in both Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank, is open to a merger between Germany's two biggest lenders, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, raising the chances of a tie-up.
headlineTitle: Investor Cerberus open to Deutsche Bank merger with Commerzbank: source

headlineText: Standard Chartered is targeting more trade-focused business from Chinese companies by hiring around 15 bankers worldwide, a source familiar with the plans told Reuters.
headlineTitle: StanChart hiring Chinese-speaking bankers to connect its network

headlineText: Bayer's $63 billion purchase of U.S. seeds maker Monsanto made its mark on the German company's fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, lifting profit and boding well for the peak season of its enlarged agriculture business.
headlineTitle: Bayer reaps profit lift from Monsanto seeds, consumer health

headlineText: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk to explain by March 11 why he should not be held in contempt for violating his fraud settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
headlineTitle: Tesla's Musk must address SEC contempt bid as he calls agency 'broken'

headlineText: Ahold Delhaize, which operates supermarkets in Europe and the United States, is on track to meet a 20 percent U.S. online sales growth target this year as it opens automated grocery distribution points along the East Coast, its chief executive said on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: Ahold says on course to meet U.S. online sales growth targets

headlineText: Elliott Management Corp on Wednesday urged shareholders of a Hyundai Motor Group firm to vote for its proposal for higher dividends and new board members, a day after the South Korean conglomerate rejected demands by the U.S. activist investor.
headlineTitle: Elliott pushes for Hyundai shareholder support after dividend proposals rejected

headlineText: Harry Potter and Star Wars building sets helped Lego return to growth in 2018, along with strong sales in China, where the privately-owned Danish toymaker plans to open new stores.
headlineTitle: Wingardium Leviosa! Harry Potter magic helps Lego lift sales

headlineText: China's CDH Investments is aiming to raise nearly $1 billion in dollar and yuan funds through its venture and growth capital arm to invest in sectors including healthcare and logistics, said people with direct knowledge of the matter.
headlineTitle: China's CDH targets raising $1 billion in venture capital arm: sources

headlineText: Vietnamese carriers VietJet and Bamboo Airways formally announced on Wednesday deals with Boeing Co to buy 110 planes worth more than $15 billion as the fast-growing companies look to expand their operations in Asia and beyond.
headlineTitle: Vietnamese carriers VietJet, Bamboo unveil Boeing deals worth $15 billion

headlineText: Hyundai Motor Co said on Wednesday it plans to boost the core automotive businesses’ operating profit margin to 7 percent by 2022, compared with 2.1 percent in 2018, as part of its mid- to long-term plan.
headlineTitle: Hyundai Motor says to lift auto operating margin to 7 percent by 2022

headlineText: China's steel mills may have taken a wrong turn by adding millions of tonnes of new high-end capacity just as the country's car sector, a key steel consumer, undergoes its first contraction in decades, cutting metal demand.
headlineTitle: Hot-rolled mess: China's steelmakers hit the skids as car sales slow

headlineText: Sunrise Communications has entered "advanced discussions" to buy Liberty Global's Swiss business in a deal which values the internet and digital television provider at 6.3 billion Swiss francs ($6.30 billion).
headlineTitle: Sunrise in advanced talks for Liberty Global's $6.3 billion Swiss unit

headlineText: U.S. President Donald Trump said this week he may soon sign a deal with Chinese President Xi Jinping to end a trade war blamed for slowing global economic growth and disrupting markets.
headlineTitle: U.S.-China trade: tariff and non-tariff barriers

headlineText: After last month's deadly tailings dam disaster at a Vale SA facility in Brazil, Freeport-McMoRan Inc Chief Executive Richard Adkerson sent a memo to his 29,000 employees telling them to immediately report any safety concerns about the scores of dams his company operates.
headlineTitle: Rattled by Vale disaster, mining CEOs move to change industry

headlineText: Lockheed Martin Corp expects it will take around 15 to 20 years to bring the cost per flight hour of the F-35 below fourth-generation fighter jets such as the F-16, the head of the F-35 program said on Wednesday.
headlineTitle: Lockheed expects F-35 flying costs will take time to come down: executive

headlineText: An internal investigation by HSBC Holdings PLC into Huawei Technologies' connections to a suspected front company in Iran found that the Chinese telecommunications equipment maker maintained close financial ties to the firm years after purportedly selling the unit, documents reviewed by Reuters show.
headlineTitle: Exclusive: HSBC probe helped lead to U.S. charges against Huawei CFO

headlineText: Nevada casino regulators said on Tuesday they had fined Wynn Resorts Ltd $20 million in a settlement with the company involving misconduct claims against former chief executive Steve Wynn.
headlineTitle: Nevada regulators fine Wynn Resorts $20 million in settlement

headlineText: The U.S. Justice Department does not plan to challenge an appeals court ruling on Tuesday that found AT&T Inc's purchase of Time Warner was legal under antitrust law, the government said on Tuesday.
headlineTitle: U.S. Justice Department: no plans to appeal AT&T Time Warner ruling

headlineText: Silicon Valley billionaire Elon Musk laid into the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission again on Tuesday, after it accused the Tesla Inc chief executive officer of violating the terms of a settlement last year of fraud charges against him.
headlineTitle: Tesla's Musk calls SEC 'broken' in new Twitter spat

headlineText: Hyundai Motor Group on Tuesday rejected demands by U.S. activist investor Elliott Management for a combined 7 trillion won ($6.3 billion) dividend payout and new board members, complicating efforts to revamp South Korea's second-biggest conglomerate.
headlineTitle: Hyundai rejects Elliott's payout call, shares rise ahead of showdown meeting

headlineText: Boeing Co on Wednesday unveiled an unmanned, fighter-like jet developed in Australia and designed to fly alongside crewed aircraft in combat for a fraction of the cost.
headlineTitle: Boeing unveils unmanned combat jet developed in Australia

headlineText: The Federal Reserve is in "no rush to make a judgment" about further changes to interest rates, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell told U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday as he spelled out the central bank's approach to an economy that is likely slowing.
headlineTitle: Fed's Powell says 'no rush' to hike rates in 'solid' but slowing economy

headlineText: Papa John's International Inc forecast better-than-feared North American same-store sales on Tuesday, as the U.S. pizza chain's investments on rebranding following its months-long spat with founder John Schnatter pay off.
headlineTitle: Papa John's gives upbeat full-year forecast after rocky 2018, shares rise

headlineText: General Electric Co has too much debt and needs to reduce it "thoughtfully and soon", Chief Executive Officer Lawrence Culp said in a letter to shareholders on Tuesday.
headlineTitle: GE CEO says company needs to reduce debt 'thoughtfully and soon'

headlineText: Brazilian automaker CAOA, which produces vehicles with Korea's Hyundai Motor Co and China's Chery Automobile Co, is in talks to buy a Ford Motor Co plant in the country that is slated to close by 2019, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter.
headlineTitle: Brazil's CAOA in talks to buy Ford factory: source

headlineText: The U.S. Commerce Department announced Tuesday it will open a new anti-dumping probe to determine whether fabricated structural steel from Canada, China and Mexico is being sold at below fair value.
headlineTitle: U.S. opens anti-dumping probe into steel imports from China, Canada, Mexico

headlineText: AT&T Inc emerged victorious on Tuesday over the Trump administration's drawn-out attempts to block its $85.4 billion purchase of Time Warner as the U.S. Justice Department said it would not fight an appeals court ruling approving the deal.
headlineTitle: U.S. Justice Department will not appeal AT&T, Time Warner merger after court loss

headlineText: U.S. aerospace manufacturer Boeing Co said on Tuesday it has nominated Nikki Haley, former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations and a close ally of President Donald Trump, to join its board of directors at the company's annual shareholders meeting on April 29.
headlineTitle: Boeing nominates former U.N. ambassador Haley to join its board

headlineText: Wall Street's three major indexes fell slightly after a choppy session on Tuesday as investors eyed mixed U.S. economic data and corporate news and waited for clarity on issues such as the U.S.-China trade talks.
headlineTitle: Wall St. edges lower in choppy session

headlineText: A federal judge in Manhattan on Tuesday dismissed a wrongful death lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase & Co by the estate of a former top broker, who it said committed suicide after being forced into retirement.
headlineTitle: JPMorgan absolved by U.S. judge in former top broker's suicide

headlineText: The Federal Trade Commission, under pressure to keep closer tabs on big tech companies such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook, said on Tuesday it would create a task force to monitor the sector and investigate anticompetitive conduct.
headlineTitle: U.S. consumer regulator forms task force to monitor big tech

headlineText: EBay Inc has informed Elliott Management Corp it is willing to explore shedding some of its key assets and give the hedge fund board representation in a bid to avert a proxy contest, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
headlineTitle: EBay offers concessions to avert fight with Elliott: sources

headlineText: A manager at Brazilian iron ore miner Vale SA told authorities that the company's executive board knew there had been a "decrease in security" at the dam that burst in January, killing hundreds, according to a newspaper report on Tuesday.
headlineTitle: Manager at Brazil's Vale told executives of dam risks: newspaper

headlineText: U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to delay raising tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods has helped push global stock markets broadly higher as investors hope for a resolution in the trade war between the world's two largest economies.
headlineTitle: Why some U.S. fund managers like China regardless of trade deal

headlineText: Rising risks and recent soft data shouldn't prevent solid growth for the U.S. economy this year, but the Federal Reserve will remain "patient" in deciding on further interest rate hikes, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.
headlineTitle: Instant View: Powell - Fed remains patient deciding on further hikes

headlineText: JPMorgan Chase & Co, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, said on Tuesday it expects to face rising costs for deposits, a key part of its business, and slowing global economic growth.
headlineTitle: JPMorgan keeps key profit goal, cautious on U.S. recession risks

headlineText: Uber Technologies Inc will announce plans to acquire Dubai-based rival Careem Networks FZ as early as this week, Bloomberg reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.
headlineTitle: Uber to announce deal to buy rival Careem as early as this week: Bloomberg

headlineText: An Ethiopian Airlines executive questioned whether Boeing had told pilots enough about "aggressive" software that pushes a plane's nose down, a focus of investigation into a deadly crash in Ethiopia this month.
headlineTitle: Ethiopian Airlines questions Boeing's 'aggressive' software

headlineText: American Airlines said Sunday it will extend flight cancellation through April 24 because of the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX after two fatal crashes since October and cut some additional flights.
headlineTitle: American Airlines extends Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations through April 24

headlineText: Bayer's management retains the backing of its supervisory board, its chief executive said, after pressure on the company increased when a second jury in the United States ruled its glyphosate-based Roundup weed killer caused cancer.
headlineTitle: Bayer CEO says his team retains backing of supervisory board: report

headlineText: Ahead of fresh high-level trade talks this week, China is not conceding to U.S. demands to ease curbs on technology companies, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing three people briefed on the discussions.
headlineTitle: China refuses to concede on U.S. demands to ease curbs on tech firms: FT

headlineText: Turkey's banking watchdog said it had launched an investigation into JP Morgan and other banks over complaints it received after the lira plunged more than 4 percent and the main share index fell sharply on Friday.
headlineTitle: Turkish watchdogs to probe JP Morgan after lira plunge

headlineText: British entrepreneur Mike Lynch vigorously denies new U.S. criminal charges against him, his spokesman said on Saturday ahead of a court case over the sale of his firm Autonomy which will begin in London next week.
headlineTitle: Ex-Autonomy CEO Lynch denies new U.S. charges against him

headlineText: United States Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will travel to Beijing for the latest round of high-level trade talks scheduled to start on March 28, the White House said in a statement on Saturday.
headlineTitle: U.S.'s Lighthizer, Mnuchin to travel to China for trade talks: White House

headlineText: The southern Indian state of Karnataka kept the door open on Saturday to talks with local ride-hailing service Ola to avoid a ban that could help rival Uber build market share.
headlineTitle: Indian state open for talks with Uber rival Ola over ban

headlineText: Apple chief executive Tim Cook nudged China on Saturday to open up and said the future would depend on global collaboration, as the United States and China remained locked in a bitter trade dispute.
headlineTitle: Apple's Cook to China: keep opening for sake of global economy
